publicationstmt.publisher: Digital Collections and Archives, Tufts University

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-10-08 11:18:46 -0400.

repository.corpname: Digital Collections and Archives, Tufts University

did.abstract: This collection contains fliers, photographs, and an essay created or compiled by Carl Manikian (E1972, A1974, D1977). Materials relate to campus life and Manikian's residence in Carmichael Hall.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Carl Manikian, 2015, accession number 2015.051.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged in one series.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Carl Manikian graduated from the Tufts School of Engineering in 1972, the Graduate School of Arts and Sciences in 1974, and the Dental School in 1977. He maintained dental offices in Lowell, Massachusetts and the Danville/East Hampstead area of New Hampshire.

As an undergraduate, Manikian lived in Carmichael Hall and was active in dorm government. He helped organize events in Carmichael Hall's lounge, including concerts, all night movie nights, dorm meetings, parties, and the First Annual Riotous Carmichael Extravaganza (F.A.R.C.E) in 1969. Manikian also helped promote these events through creating and distributing clever flyers. In the fall of 1974, Dean of Students Jim Steindler created the position of Social-Cultural coordinator for Carmichael Hall, and appointed Manikian to the position. Then in his first year of dental school, Manikian continued to live in Carmichael Hall and arrange for social events, including faculty lectures, concerts, and artist presentations.
As a resident of Carmichael Hall, Manikian was close to the site of the fire at Barnum Hall on April 14, 1975, and took numerous photographs of the scene.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Carl Manikian Papers, 1968-2015. Tufts University. Digital Collections and Archives. Medford, MA.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processing of this collection was completed by Leah Edelman in 2018. Physical materials were placed in archival folders, and digital materials were stabilized, bagged, and ingested to the digital library. Materials were arranged by format. A file and item-level inventory, series-level description, and finding aid were created at the time of processing.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains photocopied handmade flyers for events at Carmichael Hall, including movie nights, dorm meetings, concerts, parties, and other events, as well as a poster and program for First Annual Riotous Carmichael Extravaganza (F.A.R.C.E), held in March of 1969 and featuring the James Cotton Blues Band. This collection also contains an essay by Manikian on campus life and Tufts history, and photographs he took of the fire at Barnum Hall on April 14, 1975.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Some material in this collection may be protected by copyright and other rights. Please see "Reproductions and Use" on the Digital Collections and Archives website for more information about reproductions and permission to publish. No documentation is available regarding the intellectual property rights in this collection.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged roughly by format.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This series is open for research.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

This series also contains an essay by Manikian on campus life and Tufts history, and photographs he took of the fire at Barnum Hall on April 14, 1975.
